caption: Rocking live music, excellent food and attentive service. Don't forget the Brussels sprouts starter! You never had B sprouts so good!!
Welcoming atmosphere with great food and great live music concerts on the weekends!
Phenomenal service. Even better food.

Amazing food, drinks, and live music! Tambour is a neighborhood gem with quality everything...be sure to get the crispy pork! Important to note that they kitchen/staff is accommodating to allergies. Enjoy!

two days ago was our first time we visited this fine restaurant. But It is absolutely not the last time. We passed a splendid evening with the courteous service, with the exceptional  meal and fine drinks and with the honest pay. We will no doubt come back soon.
Best decision I ever made on Caviar, phenomenal shrimp ajillo & burger

Doing the some very delicious, very thoughtful food options despite the challenges of the pandemic era. Highly recommend. And if you just want a burger or other comfort sandwiches, there is really no need to go further than Tambour. Also still doing some live music through the windows, and of course great drinks.
Ordered takeout from here last night - the burger, meatballs and crab cakes. Food was delicious and generous portions for appetizers. Will be our new go-to Place!

This place is a gem. Good food and great live music in south slope! Just a few blocks from the prospect ave stop on the R. A great place to spend the evening and enjoy music, wine and farm to table food. Currently on view: lush photography by NYC Artist Stacy Greene

Tambour is fantastic!  We came for dinner and live music last night and were floored by the beautiful ambiance and welcoming staff.  The food is incredible, menu options to appeal to all palates as well as a beautifully curated wine list.  Our server was attentive, patient and we never felt rushed.  Plenty of time to enjoy the wine, food and live music by Reggie Young which made for an amazing night.  Owners Amy and Nick are welcoming and lovely.  Looking forward to our next visit.
Michelin star food

A warm neighborhood great hangout place, reasonably priced and very nicely presented dishes by the young and talented chef. No mixed drinks but a good selection of vines. Lucky for those who can just walk in for a nice dinner and get to listen to local musicians whose music is their passion

Tambour is a real gem!  The food, the ambiance....and the music!  If you like live jazz, it is right here in the South Slope.  If you like live jazz without a crowd...it is right here in the South Slope.  The food is excellent, of course, all of it.  Really nice folks too.  Enjoy.

Hidden gem here for sure Loved finding this place with a friend. Came in looking for quick cocktails but chef Adam and owners Eric and Nick persuaded us to try a few dishes and let me tell you, this is our new after work joint. Definitely your neighborhood place with a dose of delicious food! Glad we decided to randomly after werk our way here! I had the steak as well as the scallop fois, aaaammmmaaaaazzzzzz!
Excellent food;attentive service and live music after 9.perfect note out!
The owner lady is very professional, efficient and friendly. Workers are well trained and respectful. 100% recommenf

My friend and I dined at Tambour Bistro last night and it was absolutely wonderful! The ambiance set the stage for a relaxed and fun evening - from the general decor to the details such as the beautiful stemware. We shared the delicious salad to start followed by our entrees of Salmon and Risotto which were incredibly fresh and perfectly prepared. There is a wine pairing on the menu which is an extra treat. There was live jazz music which added to the experience. Our waitress was terrific and the owner Amy was warm and inviting! This is my first restaurant review and I just had to share our experience and encourage others to enjoy this delightful Brooklyn Bistro!
Really good steak and delicious music
GREAT TIME TO DO AGAIN...
Service was great.  Waffles were overcooked.  Potatoes were undercooked.  Menu is limited.
Excellent ambient, music and food!

We came for brunch it was hands down the BEST brunch I’ve had in the area in a while. The atmosphere is wonderful (there was live music (the Dan) but not overpowering) the staff is super friendly, the food is high quality (Michelin star chef) and made to order. I had the eggs Benedict with the creamed arugula. My two friends had the Benedict with the gravalax. The dinner menu looks delicious as well. Try the sour cherry Prosecco!
I found a gem in park slope food was excellent so try it out
Very good food. Nice atmosphere very nice people who work there I had the steak on brunch menus 😊
Excellent experience

I have been going to Tambour since it first opened in early 2018. And, now they have a fantastic new Michelin Star Chef, Kamran Naseem. I went last week to sample the new menu & had delicious seared salmon, burrata with ratatouille, great Prosecco and a fab dessert. They also have stellar live music (free!) & great original art on the walls. A lovey husband/wife makes for a cozy & welcoming setting! Check it out!

I’ve already eaten here 4 times! I never eat less than 3 courses so I’ve tried a big selection of their menu. The food is consistently excellent as well as their suggested wine pairings! Their meats are prime from OttoManellis and the quality of their other ingredients is top quality. Also, the ambiance is friendly, unpretentious, and charming. There’s table dining and beautiful bar dining over which hangs a classic French chandelier. Also the live music is great! I highly recommend a night out at Tambour!
I love going to Tambour! The food is excellent,  the music is great, the owners and chef are personable and fun. I highly recommend this spot!
Overpriced. Bland food.

A small but very diverse menu. Everything was fresh and delicious. Especially loved the mussels Pernod with fennel and bacon. My husband loved the Beef Prime Rib, cooked and seasoned to perfection. Live music on Friday and Saturday is incomparable! This was our 3rd visit and this place is consistently terrific. Also a great atmosphere that includes a changing exhibit of local artists!

Normally love this place, but had a very bad experience with the new chef. He kept asking me to go home with him and tried inappropriately touching me at the bar, despite me declining multiple times.  Uninvited sexual harassment as a customer is unacceptable, and I have to say something because I've heard he's done this to other lone female diners before. Warning for women, do not go here while he's working. As a server, I've never dealt with such horrifying before as a paying customer.  Food and other servers were great, chef was creepy and horrible.
Goid food and wine
Love the food,  the wine, the staff, and the music on Friday nights.  It is a great place... a few blocks away from the crowds of Park Slope, but so worthwhile.
Great  steak and great creme brule French toast
Good food and a well blanced wine list. Friendly service but not too much. relaxing decor
Great for just grabbing a bite to eat or a spacial occasion and everything in between! Our favorite go to spot when we are in Brooklyn! Super high quality food meticulously prepared!
Food is simply amazing!
Very friendly staff.. food looks and smells great!!
Amazing food and music ! Really great Sunday brunch 🌷

This is my 3rd visit and Tambour, with their new chef, does not disappoint! What I like best are the complex flavor profiles he develops. They don’t cut corners on spices and herbs or ingredients! I started with Red Baby Beet Salad, which is elevated above the rest by the perfect balance of sweet and salty tempered with creamy, grade A, goat cheese (it really tastes like goat cheese!) finished off with a drizzle of honey! My first entrée, was the vegetarian Siciliano Cauliflower Steak. It’s a snow white cauliflower roasted and compressed into a dense “cut with a knife” texture with a smoky, nutty taste enhanced by the addition of roasted pine nuts (sublime on their own), basil gremolata and raisins atop a base of Quinoa. From the ingredients you can see how the chef builds flavors. Next, I chose the Lasagna Bolognese Pasta. I gave up on Lasagna long ago, wearied of getting questionable noodles, nondescript red sauce, no cream or ricotta and smothered in low quality (tasteless) mozzarella. But this sauce is made with ribeye and filet, which I love! It was hand cut from a huge pan of lasagna made by the chef! This is not just thrown together from separate pots and broiled when ordered. This is real Bolognese sauce simmered to perfection with handmade tender pasta like it should be to absorb the sauce. I cringe hearing “al dente” for raw in the middle,  undercooked pasta AND risotto!!?@#! Tambour’s lasagna actually has creamy Bechamel sauce created by the chef and is topped with “fresh” mozzarella and slivers of fresh basil. To tie all the ingredients together and brighten their flavors is the faintest hint of lemon zest!! WOW! I used the last of the bread to clean my plate! But even more, they suggest pairing wines that don’t make sense until you put them together with the cuisine-even a wine from Lebanon! They know their wine and are spot on with their pairings. Dining should be fun and this is fun! This is not pretentious food (no foam, yay!) or atmosphere but fine dining at its best in a charming, cozy new restaurant! I’ve eaten meals from Morocco to Fiji and I highly recommend Tambour!
Favorite spot in South Slope. You dig!
The food and service were top notch
Food isn't that good, service is terrible. Not as expensive as it look but not cheap either.
Great food, great atmosphere, excellent service, can't wait to come back here again!
Chef Tommy is amazing.  Food was very good.
Fantastic menu. looking forward to going back. Try the cloud cake (cheesecake)

The food here is amazing , like really really good!  They have a great chef really unique and healthy food .  We were here for weekend brunch but I’m sure dinner is great too. Great spot for food and bar. And I must say the best restaurant in the area!
Top Notch Spot for Steak Dinners, Live Music, and Brunches!

Quiet little place with really good food. Walked in here after exploring the cemetery and had one of the best burgers i’ve had in NYC. We had deserts too, also great, and wine pairings were a nice touch. The kind of place i would not review if it was in my neighbourhood so that i could have it to myself!

Love the place and the vibe! The live music has an enchanting sense of camaraderie and it’s great seeing the audience and the musicians share that same cool feeling. Excellent service and amazing chill place for live music.

One of the best wine selection's I've ever experienced. Well balanced and wonderful thoughtful recommendations for each delightful dish. Most nights have wonderful world renowned jazz, great musicians who know how to play in a small space with care for eardrums (!!) while still being engaging and heartfelt. A new chef just started and we're looking forward to to having another brunch spot in the neighborhood. The staff, Angel, Jen and Sergio could not be nicer! The owners Amy and Nicolas are wonderful and invested in the neighborhood feel of the place. Looking forward to many more meals.  Edit: Dinner could not be better. My husband had the Cuban sandwich (an evenings special) and can't stop talking about it. Of course the burger is also perfection. I loved the soups, exactly what I wanted this time of year. Every time we leave we are full and happy, what more can you ask for?  Edit: Brunch was perfect! Husband got an amazing burger and I got incredible French toast. Would definitely recommend. - They have also added $11 unlimited mimosas for 100minutes.
Very friendly staff and the Cuban sandwich on special was excellent.
Wow just wow this place is amazing. You need to try this!

I love the fact that there is something classy in the neighborhood!  The owners and staff are so gracious and the food and wine beyond expectations. Oh, and did I mention there is live music?  Wonderful and so happy Tambour moved in!
Nice place.

This restaurant is a passion project of three owners and you can tell - in the decor, the service, the food (which was incredible), the wine selection, and the live jazz music. So happy this restaurant exists!

I just went to meet a friend, My wife and I had no expectations on the food. I was beyond surprised on the quality and the quality of ingredients. I had a special, - The Lasagna w/rib-eye steak was amazing.(replacing the pork or ground meat was a great idea), super tender. Wines were a great selection and they have pairings, healthy menu, and tasty! It seems brand new, a little stark visually, but I expect it will fill in, but super clean. Live Jazz, Blues on weekend I'm told. I will travel from Manhattan for this quality for these prices.
Wow! Such a nice and cozy place! Love the music!
Great venue with tasty food and awesome live music!!! 😯 Friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Definitely worth checking out!!! 😎

This place is a 12 on the 1-10 scale!!!!! We loved it!  The food is crazy good.  Must try the meatballs, flatbread and the stake sandwiche, omg.  Lets talk about thier servers wow the best.  Sergio, Jean and Angilic were the best!!!  They are so very attentive!  Now last but definitely not least, was the band Chuck and Friends.  I cant express enough what an awesome time we had!  Cant wait to go back. Signed: Abraham & Mita
Waited for the 2nd visit to review - super friendly, great wines, great food. Stop reading - come and eat/drink.
Such a special place.  Food is so good and portions are huge.  Service very friendly and fast!  Live music sets the mood.  You have to try this gem!
Great food and music and doesn't break the bank. Loved it. Going back.
What a great restaurant. Also providing great music on the weekends.
Great food, great wine and great staff!
Really good pairings. Really good food

The food was phenomenal. Their suggested wine pairings complemented the food very well. The place has a great vibe and awesome aesthetic. It's also very clean and smells nice. Will be frequenting Tambour often.

This neighbourhood really needed this place. The menu is small, but oh so well executed. A small menu is usually a good sign in my book. Last time I was there I had the Smoked Ribeye with Bok Choy and it was excellent. The steak had a decent amount of fat on it, I think more places need to do this. The Bok Choy was perfectly cooked, and it is refreshing to have steak not served with fries. Apart from the excellent food, the wine list here is well thought out and all the wine is affordable. The wine person has done an amazing job of sourcing some very good wines that will not break the bank, and I'm talking below $50. Sit at the bar and tell him what you like and he will come up with something you will enjoy. Service is prompt and very friendly. Finally there is always live music to enjoy (as long as you like jazz). This is a great local place to eat and hangout.

Wandered in during a snow storm last night and was pleasantly surprised! The wine list is excellent and prices are decent, friendly staff, live music and exceptional seafood dish. Will definitely return!
Cozy atmosphere, great food, and live music!
Delicious! I keep coming back for more. The atmosphere is terrific and the staff are passionate about creating a wonderful dining experience.

As a resident of South Slope, Brooklyn for over 4 years, it was a welcome surprise to find that a proper wine bar had opened in my neighborhood a mere 4 block walk from my home!  This beautifully designed location features, without question, the finest wines by the glass selection I have yet encountered in our borough.  Well thought out, with a clear passion for providing a wonderful experience for the wine consumer.  An exquisite food menu with suggested pairings and weekend live music makes Tambour an exciting gem of an establishment to our section of Brooklyn.

This is the neighborhood French bistro with music on the weekends that I alway wanted to have in my neighborhood! Great food, cool tunes, excellent selection of wines at reasonable prices. Who could ask for more?
